title: Find & Verify Business Emails Automatically with OpenRouter, Serper & Prospeo
author: Naveen Choudhary

Snippet1: {{ $('Get Email Pattern').item.json.organic[0].snippet }}
Snippet2: {{ $('Get Email Pattern').item.json.organic[1].snippet }}
Snippet3: {{ $('Get Email Pattern').item.json.organic[2].snippet }}

Use the extracted email pattern to build email address for:
First Name: {{ $('Get Rows').item.json['First Name'] }}
Last Name: {{ $('Get Rows').item.json['Last Name'] }}
Domain: {{ $('Get Rows').item.json.Domain }}","options":{"systemMessage":"=You are an expert email pattern analyzer and constructor. Your task is to:

1. Analyze three website snippets from a domain to identify the common email pattern used at that company.
2. Based on your analysis, construct a likely email address for a specific person using their first name, last name, and the company domain.

## Rules for pattern identification:
- Look for any visible email addresses in the snippets (e.g., contact@company.com, j.smith@domain.com)
- Identify patterns such as:
  * first.last@domain.com
  * first_last@domain.com
  * firstlast@domain.com
  * first@domain.com
  * first.initial.last@domain.com
  * last.first@domain.com
  * firstinitiallast@domain.com
  * lastfirst@domain.com
  * etc.

## If no clear pattern is found:
- Suggest the most probable pattern based on common business email conventions
- Rank your confidence level in the suggested pattern (high, medium, low)
- Propose 1-2 alternative patterns as backups

## Output format:
1. **Identified Pattern**: [pattern description]
2. **Confidence**: [high/medium/low]
3. **Constructed Email**: [email address using the pattern]
4. **Alternative Formats**: [1-2 backup email formats if confidence is not high]

Important: Your entire response must be valid JSON only, with no explanatory text before or after. Do not include markdown formatting, backticks, or code blocks around the JSON.


Be precise, analytical, and logical in your pattern detection and email construction."},"promptType":"define","hasOutputParser":true},"notesInFlow":false,"retryOnFail":false,"typeVersion":1.9},{"id":"bcb79bcf-55f6-406c-9fea-ff6d09f8bcae","name":"OpenRouter Chat Model","type":"@n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatOpenRouter","position":[1260,600],"parameters":{"model":"openai/o3-mini","options":{}},"credentials":{"openRouterApi":{"id":"as3Nrpj9fJwXfB8s","name":"OpenRouter account"}},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"c5ea7423-66d2-448e-90f2-934f41cc946f","name":"Structured Output Parser","type":"@n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.outputParserStructured","position":[1600,600],"parameters":{"jsonSchemaExample":"{
  "identifiedPattern": "first.last@domain.com",
  "confidence": "high",
  "constructedEmail": "john.doe@example.com",
  "alternativeFormats": [
    "j.doe@example.com",

  ]
}"},"typeVersion":1.2},{"id":"6d33e7da-b138-4853-a615-4617df2b5736","name":"Verify readme:
#### **Who is this template for?** Growth teams, SDRs, recruiters, or anyone who routinely hunts for hardâ€‘toâ€‘find business emails and would rather spend time reaching out than guessing formats. #### **What problem does this workflow solve?** Manually piecing together email patterns, crossâ€‘checking them in a verifier, and updating a tracking sheet is slow and errorâ€‘prone. This template automates the entire loopâ€”research, guess, verify, and logâ€”so you hit **Start** and watch rows fill up with readyâ€‘toâ€‘send addresses. #### **What this workflow does** 1. **Pull fresh leads** â€“ Grabs only the rows in your Google Sheet where `Status` = `FALSE`. 2. **Find the company pattern** â€“ Queries **Serper.dev** for snippets and feeds them to **Gemini Flash** (via OpenRouter) to spot the dominant email format. 3. **Build the address** â€“ Constructs a likely email for every first/last name. 4. **Verify in real time** â€“ Pings **Prospeo** by default (API) _or_ lets you bulkâ€‘clean in **[Sparkle.io](http://Sparkle.io)**. 5. **Write it back** â€“ Updates the sheet with pattern, email, confidence, verification status, and flips `Status` to `TRUE`. 6. **Loop until done** â€“ Runs batchâ€‘byâ€‘batch so you never hit API limits. * * * ### ğŸ†“ **Work freeâ€‘tier magic (up to ~2,500 contacts/month)** Service | Free allowance | How this template uses it ---|---|--- **Serper.dev** | 2,500 searches/mo | Scrapes three public email snippets per domain to learn the pattern **[Sparkle.io](http://Sparkle.io)** | 10,000 bulk verifications/day | Manual _uploadâ€‘download_ optionâ€”perfect to clean your first 2.5k emails at zero cost **Prospeo** | 75 API calls/mo | Builtâ€‘in if you prefer _fully automated_ verification **Quick Sparkle workflow:** 1. Let the template generate emails. 2. Export the â€œEmailâ€ column to CSV â†’ upload to [Sparkle.io](http://Sparkle.io). 3. Download the results and paste the "verification_status" back into the sheet (or add a small n8n import subâ€‘flow). * * * #### **Setup (5 minutes)** 1. **Copy the Google Sheet** linked in the sticky note and paste its ID into the _Get Rows_ and _Update Rows_ nodes. 2. Add credentials for Google Sheets, Serper (Xâ€‘APIâ€‘KEY), OpenRouter, and _optionally_ Prospeo. 3. Hit **Execute Workflow** â€”thatâ€™s it. * * * #### **How to customise** * **Prefer Sparkle for volume:** Skip the Prospeo node, export emails in one click, bulkâ€‘verify in Sparkle, and reâ€‘import results. * **Swap the search source:** Replace the _Get Email Pattern_ HTTP node with Bing, Brave, etc. * **Extend enrichment:** Add phone lookâ€‘ups or LinkedIn scrapers before the _Update Rows_ node. * **Autoâ€‘run:** Replace the Manual Trigger with a Cron node so the sheet cleans itself every morning. * * * ### **Additional resources** Tool | Purpose | Link ---|---|--- **Prospeo** â€“ APIâ€‘ready email verification
**Special offer:** 20 % free credits for the first 3 months on any plan using this link! | Realâ€‘time, singleâ€‘call mailbox validation | [prospeo.io](https://prospeo.io/?via=naveen) **[Sparkle.io](http://Sparkle.io)** â€“ highâ€‘volume bulk verifier (manual upload) | Free daily quota of 10 000 verifications | [app.sparkle.io/signâ€‘up](https://app.sparkle.io/sign-up) **OpenRouter** â€“ API gateway for Gemini Flash & other LLMs | One key unlocks multiple frontier models | [openrouter.ai](https://openrouter.ai/) **Serper.dev** â€“ Google Search API | 2 500 searches/month on the free tier | [serper.dev](https://serper.dev/) Add the relevant keys or signup details from these links, drop them into the matching n8n credentials, and youâ€™re all set to enrich your first 2 500 contacts at zero cost. Happy building!
